entries.title: AI changelog web app completed and deployed
entries.whats_new: The AI-powered changelog web application has been finished, including automatic summarization of Git commits, deployment on Railway and Vercel, and code cleanup.
entries.breaking_change: The web app now automatically generates changelogs by analyzing commit history, providing users with summarized and impact-based entries.
entries.impact: Users will receive automatically generated and summarized changelogs with relevant impact information, simplifying change tracking.

entries.title: Deployment on Railway and Vercel successful
entries.whats_new: API has been deployed on Railway, and the front-end is live on Vercel, enabling public access to the changelog service.
entries.impact: This allows users to access the changelog application online, enhancing availability and usability.

entries.title: Bugs on saving to Git fixed
entries.whats_new: Resolved bugs related to saving changelog entries to Git repositories, improving reliability.
entries.impact: Users can now save changelog updates to their repositories without errors, ensuring data consistency.

entries.title: GitHub repository save bug fixed
entries.whats_new: The issue preventing changelog entries from being saved to GitHub repositories has been corrected.
entries.impact: Enables seamless saving of changelog data directly to user repositories, improving workflow.

entries.title: Local and API cache strategies maintained
entries.whats_new: The system continues to store changelog cache locally and via GitHub API for efficient data retrieval.
entries.impact: Improves performance and reduces redundant data fetching, leading to faster changelog display.

entries.title: Configuration options added for users
entries.whats_new: Users can now configure their own Git repositories, OpenAI LLM, API keys, and other settings.
entries.breaking_change: Allowing user customization introduces flexibility but also changes the way configurations are managed, potentially affecting existing workflows.
entries.impact: Users gain the ability to personalize and optimize changelog generation based on their repositories and AI models, but must manage their API keys and settings securely.

entries.title: Frontend improvements and interface enhancements
entries.whats_new: Improved the home page design, added a loading effect, and decorated the changelog detail page with clickable entries for details.
entries.breaking_change: Now, when a user clicks a changelog entry, it navigates to detailed information, changing previous static behaviors.
entries.impact: Enhances user experience by providing intuitive navigation and detailed change insights.

entries.title: Backend cache strategy changed to JSON file generation
entries.whats_new: The backend now creates a JSON cache file which the frontend loads initially before fetching fresh data.
entries.breaking_change: The API now generates a JSON cache before presenting changelog data, which affects how data is retrieved and displayed.
entries.impact: Improves performance by reducing load times, but might introduce slight delays if cache needs updating.

entries.title: Changelog detail page implemented with entry navigation
entries.whats_new: Clicking a changelog entry now redirects to a detailed view of that specific change.
entries.breaking_change: Navigation behavior changed from static list to interactive detailed views, providing more context.
entries.impact: Users can explore specific changelog entries in detail, enhancing clarity and traceability.

entries.title: Basic front-end web interface created for changelog display
entries.whats_new: A simple web interface now displays automatically generated changelogs, including essential information like date, news, impact, and breaking changes.
entries.breaking_change: The frontend now automatically fetches and displays changelog data, replacing manual or static content.
entries.impact: Provides users with a visual and accessible way to view project changes directly from the web.
